It's reported as critical. uninstall the openoffice-gtk package and it will work

yes, but wait a minute i'll doublecheck

yes, both packages, openoffice.org-gtk and -gnome. that's good. be sure to have OO closed while doing this ;)

yeah, it looks shitty though ^^ I hope they'll fix that soon....
Add compiz --fusion to your session
(System/Preferences/Sessions)

or better add " compiz --replace -c emerald" ^^
